column4: you will need at least the xserver-xorg package to get an X server

Ok, now I've installed xserver-xorg, but when trying to run "startx" it fails, giving me errors of it cant open /dev/wacom and some fonts, then it says: "Fatal server error:", "could not open default font 'fixed'", "XIO: fatal IO error 104 (connection reset by peer) on X server ":0.0" after 0 requests (0 known processed) with 0 events remaining."
you need some of the xfonts packages installed too
is there any reason you can't just install one of the -desktop packages to get all the dependencies?
its a low-end computer with limited resources and hard-drive..
what about xubuntu? that's what it's designed for..
installing xubuntu-desktop then remove xfce and install fluxbox instead if you want that, probably will be easiest
I also want to learn a little more of how a distro is built, so just taking 2 flies in one smack :)
but do you know the names of the xfont packages?
there are quite a few, "apt-cache search xfonts" to see them
what was the command for scrolling trough lots of input in console?
you can pipe it to less, so "apt-cache search foo | less" will let you scroll up and down with the cursor keys
i mean output of course, i remember i pressed a button and the next chunk of output was displayed..
apt-cache search foo | more will do that
but "less" is better because it lets you scroll back up as well :)
